com.tellerulam.logic4mqtt.api

Class Mail

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tellerulam.logic4mqtt.api.Mail

  • public class Mail
extends java.lang.Object
    The Mail class supports sending E-Mail. It utilizies the Java Mail subsystem: https://java.net/projects/javamail/pages/Home Parameters are specified using key=value pairs (or an object in Javascript). Default parameters can be specified using setDefaultParameters() and will be inherited by all subsequent sendMail() calls. The following parameters are supported:
    • from - sender address
    • to - receiving address
    • host - SMTP relay host (defaults to localhost)
    • user - SMTP server login
    • password - SMTP server password
    • priority - X-Priority value (1..5) (highest to lowest)
    Additionally, all of the standard Java Mail API properties are supported: https://javamail.java.net/nonav/docs/api/ Since mail sending can take an arbitrary amount of time, sending is asynchronous. This means that network errors or rejects will not be returned by the sendEmail function; they will be logged, however.

      • sendMail

        public void sendMail(java.lang.String subject,
                     java.lang.String body,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params,
                     java.lang.String... attachments)
        Send an email. Sending is asynchronous, so this function will not return transport errors or other failures.
        Parameters:
        subject - Subject of the mail
        body - Body text of the mail
        params - Additional parameters, overwriting or amending the setDefaultProperties() default properties
        attachments - List of files to attach to the mail
